title: Kenneth French
text:
Kenneth Ronald "Ken" French (born March 10, 1954) is the Roth Family Distinguished Professor of <a href="Finance">Finance</a> at the <a href="Tuck%20School%20of%20Business">Tuck School of Business</a>, <a href="Dartmouth%20College">Dartmouth College</a>. He has previously been a <a href="Faculty%20%28teaching%20staff%29">faculty</a> member at <a href="MIT">MIT</a>, the <a href="Yale%20School%20of%20Management">Yale School of Management</a>, and the <a href="University%20of%20Chicago%20Booth%20School%20of%20Business">University of Chicago Booth School of Business</a>. He is most famous for his work on <a href="Valuation%20%28finance%29">asset pricing</a> with <a href="Eugene%20Fama">Eugene Fama</a>. They wrote a series of papers that cast doubt on the validity of the <a href="Capital%20asset%20pricing%20model">Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM)</a>, which posits that a stock's <a href="Beta%20%28finance%29">beta</a> alone should explain its average return. These papers describe two factors above and beyond a stock's market beta which can explain differences in stock returns: market capitalization and "value". They also offer evidence that a variety of patterns in average returns, often labeled as "anomalies" in past work, can be explained with their <a href="Fama%E2%80%93French%20three-factor%20model">Fama–French three-factor model</a>.
Along with contributing articles to major journals such as the "<a href="Journal%20of%20Finance">Journal of Finance</a>", the "<a href="Journal%20of%20Financial%20Economics">Journal of Financial Economics</a>", the "Review of Financial Studies", the "<a href="American%20Economic%20Review">American Economic Review</a>", the "Journal of Political Economy", and the "Journal of Business", French is also a research associate at the <a href="National%20Bureau%20of%20Economic%20Research">National Bureau of Economic Research</a>, an advisory editor at the "<a href="Journal%20of%20Financial%20Economics">Journal of Financial Economics</a>", and a former associate editor of the "<a href="Journal%20of%20Finance">Journal of Finance</a>" and the Review of Financial Studies.
Professor French was the vice president of the <a href="American%20Finance%20Association">American Finance Association</a> in 2005 and was the organization's president in 2007-8. Also in 2007, Professor French was elected to the <a href="American%20Academy%20of%20Arts%20and%20Sciences">American Academy of Arts and Sciences</a> (AAAS).
He obtained a <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Science">B.S.</a> in 1975, from <a href="Lehigh%20University">Lehigh University</a> in <a href="mechanical%20engineering">mechanical engineering</a>. He then earned an <a href="M.B.A.">M.B.A.</a> in 1978, an <a href="Master%20of%20Science">M.S.</a> in 1981, and a Ph.D. in <a href="finance">finance</a> in 1983, all from the <a href="University%20of%20Rochester">University of Rochester</a>. In 2005, French became a Rochester Distinguished Scholar.
French is a board member of <a href="Dimensional%20Fund%20Advisors">Dimensional Fund Advisors</a> in <a href="Austin">Austin</a>, Texas, where he also works as Consultant and Head of Investment Policy.
